title: Definitely not Avenir
content:
Someone sent me [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014002713/http:/www.artdesignschools.com/careers/top-20-most-influential-fonts-in-graphic-design/). Number 19 is noted as Avenir, which it is definitely NOT. Seems to be a geometric sans with Myriad legs on the Rs.

On a side note, who compiled this list?!

Thanks!

{a}
author: Chipman223

comments.content: More like Johnston Underground, or some of the other digitized versions of this font.

Oops, we've done this before! Sorry.

[http://typophile.com/node/39466](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014002713/http:/typophile.com/node/39466 "http://typophile.com/node/39466")
Also, showing an iPhone home screen for Myriad is a poor choice, as the iPhone interface uses Helvetica.
